definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
may I offer a bit of advice
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to urge sb to drink alcohol
On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)

sentences.english: Cor. 2:8 Therefore I exhort you to confirm your love toward him.
sentences.chinese: 林后二8所以我劝你们，要向他证实你们的爱。

sentences.english: You want to find your sister tonight, I advise you to look in the Boylan Estate.
sentences.chinese: 今晚你想要找你姐姐，我劝你到博伊兰庄园去找。

sentences.english: Althogh I tried to pursuade him to stop smoking, he still could not make his mind.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我尽力劝他别抽烟了，他还是下不了决心。

sentences.english: He set on people to persuade him to wrestle with the famous wrestler .
sentences.chinese: 他嗾使人去劝他跟那个有名的摔跤师去摔跤。

sentences.english: I always made you angry, do not be persuaded, of course, has now admitted the mistake was.
sentences.chinese: 我总是惹你生气，还不听劝，当然现在已经知错了。

sentences.english: The same goes for other coddling behaviors, like pestering him to eat his vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 对于其它的溺爱也如法炮制，如劝他自己吃菜。

sentences.english: We tried to discourage him from climbing the mountain without a guide.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾设法劝他在无向导的情况下不要去爬山。

sentences.english: And some of them jumped up and went to Jesus right away.
sentences.chinese: 他们中间有些人听了劝跳起来，去拿撒勒人耶稣。

sentences.english: You can talk him into the project we are handling at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 你可以劝他加入到我们这会儿正在做的项目。

sentences.english: If you think dead, how to go persuading oneself?
sentences.chinese: 如果你想死，怎么去劝自己？

sentences.english: If you accept our counter-offer, we'll persuade the customers to place an order with you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你方接受我方还盘，我们将劝客户向你方订购。

sentences.english: Jeff han advised Mrs Sun, still have the dock she will have everything in the future.
sentences.chinese: 韩志杰仍劝孙太太，有了码头她将来就什么都有了。

sentences.english: The preface of this diary recounted life.
sentences.chinese: 这本日记的劝以佯述了她的生活。

sentences.english: She advised me against doing it.
Sir, I hope that Perseus should think better of it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，各位绅士，我劝这位珀尔修斯先生三思而行。

sentences.english: My father said, well you know, put the money away.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲劝我说，把钱存起来吧。

definition: earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
may I offer a bit of advice
to be determined to/to insist on
to soothe/to pacify/to mollify/to mediate (in a dispute etc)
